availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Jefferson County, Kentucky, banker and tobacconist. Pennsylvania native. Married to Eliza M. Graham Quigley in Warren County, Kentucky, on January 1, 1827. Father of Mary A. Quigley Morton, Laura Belle Quigley, Edward P. Quigley, Harriet Eliza Quigley, Eugenia P. Quigley, Ellen J. Quigley, Coreen A. Quigley, Lucien Quigley, and Eva Quigley. Resident of Warren County in 1830. Owned three enslaved persons in Warren County in 1830. Engaged in agriculture and commerce in Warren County in 1840. Owned seven enslaved persons in Warren County in 1840. Tobacconist in Warren County in 1850. Owned fifteen enslaved persons in Warren County in 1850. Operated the banking house of Quigley, Morton, & Co. in Jefferson County in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in Jefferson County in 1860.

Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 2, p. 422.
